Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • AI

  • public class AI
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that plays as the computer, finds the next best move by calculating a given amount of moves deep, the computer is always whtie
    Version:
    May 25, 2020
    Author:
    Shreyas Kaasyap, Sidharth Kannan, Period: 1, Assignment: ChessBot, Sources: Shreyas Kaasyap, Sidharth Kannan, Leo Yang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AI(Board b, int depth) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isCheckMate()
      returns the checkmate boolean, true if position is checkmate, false otherwise
      boolean isWhite()
      returns the whiteWon boolean, true if white has won the game, false otherwise
      Board minimax(Board board, int depth, boolean color)
      Generates the next best move for the computer, recursive method that finds the min/max board based on the iteration, returns a Board that is the best possible Board for white calculating a certain number of moves in advance

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • minimax

        public Board minimax(Board board,
                     int depth,
                     boolean color)
        Generates the next best move for the computer, recursive method that finds the min/max board based on the iteration, returns a Board that is the best possible Board for white calculating a certain number of moves in advance
        Parameters:
        board - the current board
        depth - the amount of moves in advance left to calculate
        color - true if it is white's turn, false otherwise
        Returns:
        Board
